message: technically it would all be easy
The most important thing would be to make it obvious, easy and fun to invite other people to submit pivots for your own website
could get a custom url such as csspivot.com/a/myproject, and pivots could get the link csspivot.com/a/myproject/ti07a
the big question is how to present it (on the frontpage and in the profile)
although the latter is not necessarily important (the very short urls such as csspivot.com/p950a are really nice i think)

You could create these URLs:
* user/<username> (or u/<username>), which contains the user profile, and /... will contain the pivots
* domain/<domain>/ (or d/<domain>), which will detail pivots for a domain, etc.
The custom URLs are not necessary for now. Probably something for premium users anyway.
As far as presentation right now the front page seems to be the profile. Do you want to keep it that way?
ask what they would like to see

I think eventually the header bar could be expandable to include account details on the top right also but keeping things as simple and as easy to use as possible should always be at the forefront of how the site is used.
@r3volution11 re frontpage: i think there are two ways we can take: either make it be a profile, or something like a showcase for recent projects/pivots and/or recently starred pivots/projects
i was also thinking about sending out a survey to the 150 already registered users
We can always let registered users toggle the things they would like to see on the frontpage.
I'm going to play around with different concepts once the header design is improved to where we want.
@pessimism Yea I like that big time.
@pessimism agreed. /d/<domain> works already, /u/<username> sounds good too. agreed that custom urls are a nice-to-have at a later point, and perhaps even a really nice premium feature
